text: I just had my rehearsal dinner here for my wedding. Pam could not have been more pleasant and generous to us. She gave us the entire basement area for our day when she could have had guests turned over many times down there. She let us bring in our champagne without a corking fee. Her staff cooked us the best food and treated us incredibly well the entire night. It really made the who experience for me and my husband. I would not have changed a thing. The food and wine was so reasonably priced as well. Pam just wanted to see that her staff was taken care of for the night. I cannot wait to go back for the Farfalle Salmone again soon.

Tutto Pasta: A nice place to carb up.

When you sit down, the staff brings out warm focaccia bread with oil and balsamic vinegar. If that's not enough, try the bruschetta. The ingredients are fresh and flavorful.

I prefer to eat family-style at places like this, so everyone can try a little of everything.

The pizza pollo pesto is pretty good. Chicken and pesto and mozzerella on a thin crust. Nothing too mind-blowing and the pesto is noting spectacular.

Try the Tutto Drew. Bowtie pasta in a wine/tomato/cream sauce with sausage and onions. Yum. Great comfort food.

Nice atmosphere. It's fun to grab a window seat and watch life on State Street pass by.

I think this place has excellent italian food. All the pasta is great and the atmosphere is fun! However, you are seated closely to other tables, so if that bothers you this is not the place to come. The sangria is awesome!

We were so excited to return to Madison (for a very special occasion that family from all over the USA flew in for) and to dine at Tutto Pasta for our big special night out meal.  Our 86 year old grandmother has been talking about Tutto for a decade now (last time she was in Madison celebrating another big event!) and we were so, so disappointed in our experience.  The waitstaff didn't seem to give a care about us, and in fact, seemed put off when we would ask for more water or olive oil & balsamic for our bread.  Since we were seated right in the walk-through area that is directly in front of the kitchen, we were in perfect earshot of all the rude things they said about us to the kitchen staff.  I was flabbergasted! I've worked in the industry for many years, and I would have fired my staff if that ever happened!   Additionally, before the restaurant even closed, all of the staff were eating their shift meals at the bar, watching TV, barely acknowledging us leaving.  Talk about not feeling welcome.  Talk about no appreciation for the business.  Talk about never returning to Tutto Pasta Trattoria ever again.  Was an overall drag of an experience.  Tutto, you need to raise the bar on who you hire.  They aren't representing you well AT ALL.

What a pleasant surprise!  Chicken Parm was very good!  Great marina sauce.  The vodka sauce on noodles was fantastic.  Would have been 5 stars but waiter put in wrong order initially so I had to wait while my wife ate.

I gave this place three stars for these reasons:
* good tasty foods. we had thecalamari fritti (fried calamari appetizers), spaghetti carbonara, osso buco (pork shank marinated in some spicy tomato-based sauce with risotto). The calamari fritti is one of the best I've ever eaten in Madison, and I am always picky about my squid.
* BIG portions, we could not finish everything in one meal, although my husband and I were normally not light eaters.
* reasonable price, especially since the restaurant is located on State St. and the portions are big.  However, I wish they can serve smaller portions of foods for less price.
* good bread and relaxing italian ambience
*a very friendly and good customer service (we got there at 9:30pm and left after the restaurant closed. When I told the waiter I wanted my osso buco to go and I would like some extra sauce if they have any left, the waiter asked the kitchen staff to make more sauce. I was soo impressed with this service).
The food and service were great! This is a cozy, intimate place perfect for a date night, but may not work so well for large groups

kelly, your review is totally right on. i actually wasn't going to write about it cause i thought, ugh, i went there on so many dates in college, i'll probably never go back again. 

i mean, it's good for what it is and where it is. and every college student looking for an affordable, nice date locale should go here. but if that's not you, pass it up. and hit the tutto on king instead.

ahh... memories...

I've eaten at all three incarnations of Tutto (this one, the now-closed King St one, and the one in Middleton) and this place is by far the worst.  The others are/were solid 3 star places perhaps, but not this one.  The food is ostensibly quite similar, but don't be fooled.  I've dined here several times in my life and it ranged from not too bad to terrible.  The food is inexplicably more bland for similar if not identical menu items.

The service is uniformly slow and disjointed.  Certainly among the very worst service experiences I've had in Madison.  For example, during one visit, a large insect was in my food.  It was clearly underneath the food and hadn't just randomly landed between plating and service.  It took me 20 minutes to flag down wait staff to point this out.  Rather than comping my meal, instead they offered me gift certificates to an upcoming visit and charged me full price for the meal.  They did at least offer to prepare it again.  Who would have agreed given how long I'd already been sitting there?

The restaurant is usually quite cramped, and this leads to discomfort.  Compare this to the Middleton location which is spacious and comfortable.  Perhaps the worst thing about the location is the restrooms.  Certainly among the more disgusting restrooms in a restaurant of this price range.  I know the bar is low for State Street given all that transpires there, but these guys don't even live up to the average State Street level of sanitation in their restroom.  

Given the other fine Italian restaurants in the area, there's just no good reason to go to the Tutto on State St.  Even with the King street Tutto gone, I can find no justification for going to this place.  Osteria Papavero and Nostrano are just around the corner and completely blow this place out of the water in every respect.  Better food, way better service, faster service, and clean restrooms.

Looking for a place for lunch while enjoying Maxwell street days. So we ducked into Tutto's . We were greeted, and seating immediately. Upstairs, we were seated next to the window with a view of State street. Warm bread and oil was served while we were deciding on lunch. 
The server was very friendly and even gave us advice about things to see that were close by. I opted for a healthy pasta with whole grain pasta, artichokes, saut√©ed garlic, onions baby spinach with a tomato basil sauce. It was very good! Having pasta for lunch isn't usually my thing, but" penne energy " sounded like the healthiest option! 
Oh! And the virgin mojito was fantastic! Overall it was a great experience , and I would definitely return.
The service was not great.  Portions are generous, but the pasta is not very flavorful.  From the window on State St, the dishes looked much better.  Overall, it was a disappointing experience.
omg best place in town !!! highly reccomend the marsala chicken !!!

FOOD POISONING ! 
Fortunately out of my mother and daughter, i was the only one to get sick from this restaurant..   I was also the only one who ordered a side of sauteed veggies. I got extremely sick an hour after eating here !! Yuck spoiled veggies ?!

Not to mention ths pasta was hardly edible - hard noodles drenched in salt and butter (fettuccine alfredo??) and this place is uncomfortably small. 

I wont be returning !
The food was okay, but with the setting and the hype I'd heard about the place, I expected better. I even had my friends leftovers and his pasta was pretty it was alright, nothing special.

From the exterior, the place doesn't look bad.  The olive oil and basalmic vinegar that they gave was a nice touch.  But the food was only subpar.  The chicken given in the dish was very tough, and the noodles were cardboardish.  The saving grace was that this place was pretty inexpensive, but you get what you pay for.

I've been to Tuttu Pasta many times over the years and have always liked it, even recommended it.   I can no longer recommend it because of the terrible service and utter disregard for customers.  When we first got there and our waiter ask us for our drink order I asked if I could split my daughter and I off from the other five adults who were with us, a practice relatively common in Madison, he told me begrudgingly "it's a table of 7 and normally we don't do that but I will."  It was going to be two bills...not 7, so I'm not sure that we were asking a lot. You could tell he was not happy.  So he left to get our drinks. Meanwhile, the bus person was dropping plates in a curtain-sectioned off area right next to our table, dropping them so loudly in the small space we were in that we could not hear each other talk.  This happened over and over and over again for 15 minutes or more. I am sound sensitive and it was getting me on edge. The food arrived at a reasonable time so no problems there, and the food was decent.  We tried repeatedly to get the attention of the bus person for her to stop dropping plates and silverware into her tubs in that room but she either couldn't understand us or ignored us.  So we asked our waiter if he could have a word with her to please keep the noise down when dropping the plates in the tubs because it was deafening.  He said yes, but you could tell he wasn't going to and from what we could tell he never did. After the seven of us were clearly finished, with very few tables occupied in the entire place, we waited and waited for the waiter to come back, at least 10 minutes if not longer.  He walked by several times, serving other tables, but did not check on us even though we were clearly done and waiting.  I eventually sought him out by walking downstairs to the bar where he was getting a drink order for another table and I asked him to stop by. Another long period of time passed by before he stopped by and asked about desserts.  I guess he didn't like my response in mentioning how long it had taken, so he said to me aggressively "why are you so rude?"  I told him we had been waiting an inordinate amount of time for him to get back to his table and I think I said  I likely wouldn't come back to the restaurant.  The waiter then said "Don't come back" and then I told him I'd be going on Yelp about this and he said "go ahead."  I couldn't believe what I was hearing and neither could the other adults at my table.  My sister-in-law then asked the waiter to get the manager, who came up to speak with us but the waiter was right behind her.  We asked for the waiter not to be there (why would he be?) and we then explained to the manager what happened.  The manager apologized and said it was not acceptable. The waiter was aggressive and outright confrontational with me, which I believe to be grounds for dismissal right then and there.  He was aggressive with me to the point of him losing his temper as if I, the customer, had done something wrong by expecting decent service and holding him accountable. Clearly the Management hadn't to this point.  I don't trust that anything will change at this restaurant. His arrogance and attitude toward me and the table was beyond belief.  If they're hiring people like him, then something is wrong. Then we got our bill (one bill, not two separated out as requested) and as a table of 7 they had automatically put on a tip on the bill.  I believe tables of 8 required that, not tables of 7 at this restaurant, but I could be wrong. I had to ask the manager to remove the tip to be removed completely as did the others in my party. He got no tip from me, the first time in 30 years I've ever done that. I don't expect much, but I do expect for a waiter to provide normal, attentive service. If that's what this place has become, no more for me and I can no longer recommend it. Decent food but not worth the unbelievably horrible, disrespectful service I got from this waiter, the loud disrespectful bussing from the bus person, and the fact that this guy was not talked to right then and there by the manager.  Madison has too many good restaurants for me to ever step foot in this place again.

My son and I went last night before seeing the Christmas Carol at the Ovature center. The location is great for a pre-show meal being right across the street. The service was fine but could have been more prompt, especially near the end.

I had the cream of spinach soup which was actually really tasty. The bread they must make themselves and was a highlight of the meal. It was warm and went perfectly with the olive oil/balsamic they put on a plate.

My son had the kids butter noodles which of course he enjoyed and I had a pepperoni pizza. It was very flavorful.

I like the quaint ambiance and we enjoyed our table location upstairs with a view of state street.

I'm tempted to give it four but it is not quite there yet. I would potentially go back if I had an engagement downtown and the prices were extremely reasonable.

We stopped here for lunch on a Friday afternoon with a party of six. Service was a little slow, but everyone was happy with their food. The calzone on the lunch/specials menu was very yummy although I was less than impressed with the tomato sauce they dumped on top of it. The pasta dishes with the red sauce were good though. 

The rosemary bread that gets brought to the tables is great!

Great location and super cute restaurant.
Mediocre in just about every way. Pretty basic Italian food. Not bad, but not particularly good either.

Went here for dinner. Was seated quickly, and service was fast! Staff was knowledgeable and polite. Food came out within 15 minutes, fresh and sizzling. We'll be back! Try the alfredo al limon, tons of chicken and sauce was great.
Mediocre tasting food. Ok service and food came out really fast. The spaghetti carbonara I ordered was way too creamy and the pasta was overcooked.
They forgot the appetizer, the pasta was over cooked and the insalata panzanella was a green salad with croutons. Definitely not recommend!!

This is the best pasta joint around, fettuccine vongola (clams) is top plate. Don't come here for hot waiters or for some hot trend this is good food at reasonable prices. Sitting outside is only a bonus and watch the college life walk by.

Food was delicious but the repeated offer for sex from an employee (including a cocktail napkin with phone number) was more service than I was looking for. Business manager expressed little concerned about my complaint. Paid in cash because I was not going to give out my credit card with my name.

I always enjoy any of the dishes I ordered although I can never really finish any of it because of the huge portions (which isn't really something I consider bad). Service was so-so. The waiters were nice but they never offer the dessert menu or the Parmesan unless asked. Overall, its a place I would recommend if you're feeling for good Italian food and love pasta. I feel like the experience is better if you go during lunch because it can get really crowded during dinner.

love, love, love their pastas. There are plenty of Italian restaurants on State Street already, but I wish I could replace half of them with this place. Some of my friends tried salmon salads and pesto pastas and were very pleased with the dish. Their Italian sodas are also great. Friendly and fast service was also a definite plus.

Ok so 98% sure they forgot to put in my tables order. My friends got there food, (after 28 minutes) was told by water that he was going to get my pizza. At this point I have been waiting 9 minutes and still no food for me...  11 minutes after they received there meal I got my pizza.

Got the Pizza Margherita on a weekday lunch with some colleagues.  (see uploaded photo)

The service was excellent at all times.  This is the reason I'll give them another shot.  

I'm really into Margherita pizza... it's my thing.   The average person would walk away saying this pizza was good.   This pizza lacked awesome cheese and awesome sauce.  Likely, these two ingredients weren't as fresh as they should've been.   On a positive note, it certainly kicks the s... outta Ian's or Pizza Di Roma.   

My colleagues were both happy with their pasta dishes.   

Final words--   stick to pasta here if you're eating here and stick to Cafe Porta Alba if you've got a Margherita craving.

Yuck.  I tried this place after it was suggested by a local.  This place was just gross.  I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and the meatballs were cold, and the spaghetti wasn't cooked enough (the noodles were still hard).

Service:  In a word, slow.  Like glacially slow, from the time we came in the door to paying the bill - everything was slow.  

The food: I hesitate to describe any restaurant food as bad, but I think I can't offer anything better.  Everything, from the peas, to the chicken, pasta, and sauces had the flavor and texture of low quality pre-packaged products.  For $14-$16 a plate we were extremely disappointed.  The food at a big chain like Noodles & Co or Olive Garden is significantly better than what we had here.

I cannot believe I never ate here when I was a student! They make al their pastas from scratch! If only I'd known what a treasure that is back then... 

I stopped in for lunch today and had a very nice glass of Chianti Classico with my meal. They have several Tuscans to choose from. I had a side salad (this was pretty average), some warm focaccia bread with olive oil, and a parpadelle with vodka sauce. The pasta was fantastic - fresh really makes a difference! My only criticism would be there was too much cheese in it. But hey, this is Wisconsin! 

Service was perfect, they were friendly and helpful but left me alone to work (I had brought my laptop).

Delicious food, craft beers on tap, and good service.

I've been enjoying meals here since I worked downtown in the late 90s.  It's on my short list of downtown venues, especially when my wife is in the mood for pasta or "comfort food".  Now that I'm working downtown again, it's a frequent lunch option as well.

For lunches, I tend to order off the weekly specials.  The pizzas are tasty, and sized such that I usually end up taking a third to half back to the office for later.  Eating at a sidewalk table in warmer weather is nice.

When ordering dinner entrees, the challenge is for me to not order the pollo marsala.  It's one of my favorite dishes in town.  I could pour that sauce on anything...

I was recently there in a party of ten.  One of my friends was running late, and asked me to order for her.  I ordered the pollo marsala and a salmon dish, with the intent of offering my friend her choice of meals; she kept the marsala, and I enjoyed a delicious pasta with salmon.

There isn't much room between tables.  It can be a bit noisy when the restaurant is busy.

I've been going here for years, and I almost always get their "signature" dish, the tutto pasta. With extra sauce
Always wonderful, and waitstaff is nice.   The bread is delicious. I recommend it to anyone who loves itialian!!!

Went Tuesday night at 6:30. Sat inside. Very busy, very loud, casual.  Bread was very dry.  We ordered appetizer sampler. Fried calamari was great. Bruchetta was forgettable, caprese was ok.  I ordered lasagna, which was FABULOUS!  Enough for 2 actuallY.  She ordered fettuccine Alfredo and liked it.  I had a chocolate martini ($6.50) which of course rocked. I wouldn't got another one but the waiter didn't come back until he brought the bill. Their drink prices aren't bad for Madison. It says it's a romantic atmosphere, which it isn't.  Casual restaurant with great Italian food!  It was my friends birthday so she got a free piece of tiramisu.  I'd go back with another restaurant.com deal. Our bill came to $52 minus the $15 certificate. Great deal!

$3 Long Island Ice Tea's...were they crazy? 

I had never been to Madison before but I enjoyed its charm for all the four hours I was there. The cost of living is considerably different then my home in Boston as well. 

The trattoria was pretty good throughout the whole meal...from the fried calamari that was lightly breaded so the squid stood out to my fettechinni shrimp scampi that I could not finish. Small appetites need not apply here. The pasta was obviously home made...probably why this hungry man could not clean his plate! 
Of course I saved room for dessert! The Creme Brulee was nice and smooth, very good! 
The friendly, relaxed service was great throughout the meal. The overall experience exceeded my expectations.
Funny how everyone here on yelp is fascinated with the bread at Tutto. Don't get me wrong, it was good but the rest of the food was delicious too!
The pizza here is like the kind you buy in the freezer section of a grocery store and seriously, I'd rather eat frozen pizza than have pizza here again.

Have to say. The best pasta place ever in Madison. Went to different Italian places. But the others are more expensive and in general not good. This is definitely the best. And the price is pretty decent. Strongly recommend!

Have to disagree with the other reviews.  This place has the most yummy, flavorable, delicious pastas anywhere.  Lots of great cheesy and creamy sauces with chickens, bacons, fish, caviar, mushrooms, peppers, artichokes, on and on.  I can't find pasta this good anywhere in Chicago or anywhere in Wisconsin.  They have about 30 varieties of pastas with wide ranges of pasta types and flavors.   Whether you're a pesto or garlic lover you'll find something delicious.

As far as the other comments on atmosphere and being surrounded by students on dates, I haven't really seen this here, although perhaps I haven't noticed (did college students start going on dates?).  I don't go for this place for the atmosphere I go for the incredible pasta.   This place isn't trying to be upscale italian, it's trying to be comfortable with big portions of good pasta.

They also have decent outdoor seating on State Street in the summer and a small selection of decent beers on taps (Blue Moon goes great with pasta).  Maybe the location on King Street has a nicer atmosphere, but this place still gets five stars.  I really miss it and try to squeeze it in every time back up.

My absolute FAVORITE place to get Italian!! There isn't even a close second! It's hard to choose if it's the casual, friendly, authentic atmosphere, the GREAT food or the fantastic service that I love most!

Maybe it's the price that turns off most of the reviewers, but personally, of all the over-priced restaurants in Madison, I dig Tutto Pasta. Every time I came there, my food was always piping hot, freshly made and the pasta was al dente. I also enjoyed their bread and the service was pretty good for the most part (slow at times though). They also custom-made a dish for me a couple times and I've been pretty impressed with their soups (which don't seem canned in my opinion). 

As I said, the place is pricey, but it's a good restaurant overall. In regards to the "canned" reviews, try a place like Porta Bella (couple blocks on Frances St) or Buca di Beppo (in Milwaukee) instead as the canned taste is more obvious in those places.

So many haters. Snobs, snobs everywhere. In my 3 years in Madison I've been to this place almost every two weeks. Portions are huge, price is really great for the money. Service is good, and can be ridiculously fast when they're not busy.

My favorite dishes: rigatoni nino (cream sauce pasta with chicken and mushroom), penne pollo pesto (basil pesto sauce pasta with chicken), tutto pasta (tomato cream sauce pasta with chicken, mushroom and onion), veal scaloppine with marsala wine sauce (best thing ever).

Admittedly, I didn't really like real Italian food when I went to Europe, but I don't go here to eat 'authentic' food; I just go to eat delicious food that fills me up without draining my wallet.

Had dinner there tonight.  Terrible. . I had the special of the day.  The pasta was almost crunchy so underdone.  The bread was hard and cold. Had to ask for parmesean cheese to give it some taste.  The waiter was not attentive at all. I would not recommend this resturant.  Very overpriced.

Very old school Italian place on State Street.  I was nervous coming here after my friend chose it because the reviews were bad.   But we sat upstairs which overlooked the downstairs and the outside windows.  The atmopshere was really great.  The lighting, sound, and space upstairs was perfect.  Even the drunk frat kids with margarita pitchers (at an Italian restaurant) a table across didn't bother us and couldn't kill the vibe.  

The server was nice and the food was very good.  Not high quality expensive food, but great tasting and traditional Italian fare.

The only complaint I'd really have about this place is the bathrooms.  You have to walk through the kitchen to get to them and the bathroom is very old and sketchy.

Other than that, Tutto's was a pleasent surprise.

Had reservations for dinner before the UND / UW hockey game.  The oil for the bread was great but didn't particularly care for the bread that was served with it.  All of the meals that our group of 8 had were fantastic though and we really enjoyed the meal (and the bottles of wine...).
Amazing pasta meal prepared for our team. The staff was awesome and the food very homemade and yummy!

I love tutto pasta! First off, their servers are super nice and accommodating.  Second, their portions are super filling and for a great price too.  I ordered the fettuccine au limone. It was delicious Alfredo with a zesty lemon flavor. All in all very flavorful.  The noodles were  cooked al dente -  not too mushy.   Third, they have a variety of foods.  The owner is super nice.  She's all about the customers, ad opposed to being all about the business.  The one thing is that the service is a smidge on the slower side and that it's a bit farther up state Street.  But for good Italian food, tutto is the place to be :) OH THEY HAVE WARM BREAD! WARM!!!

What is WRONG with you people who give this crappy excuse for a restaurant anything beyond one star?
Our meal was disgusting! Entrees this bad for $11?
The calamari was pre-made and frozen in a factory in China and the monkey in the kitchen just microwaved it. That was $8.00 for 5 pieces buried among the breading. 
I wanted to see their cook as I was sure they were breaking child-labor laws by hiring an 11 year old, based on the sloppiness of what came out from the kitchen.
This place is awful, even if they cut the prices by 70% to bring it in to line with what they microwave for their clientele.
If these guys were in NYC, they wouldn't possibly survive. 
Nice enough people, but they clearly don't care about food or customers.

Pretty good for what it is. Went there for a family dinner, which means nearly interminable ordering issues and a seemingly endless meal before getting manumission with the check and parting ways. The servers handled it all in stride and with good humor. The calamari was pretty good with a reasonably spicy tomato sauce. The puttanesca lacked a little of the smokiness I like, and would have benefited from better anchovies, but I have had much worse for much more $$$ and think I make it better than anyone on earth anyway. Fortunately, beer service was prompt and copious and allowed me to remain gracious and convivial for hours and hours and hours.
Every time I have gone to eat here I have walked out because no one ever shows up to seat us. When I place a delivery order I'm put on hold for at least 5 mins. Awful vet unprofessional
My husband and I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! We have fond memories of eating there while in college and just visited recently and it's still so good.0
Pizza salsicca + Pinot noir = delicious and perfect combo!!!  The pizza was cold when they brought it, but they took it back and warmed it up for me, and it was DELICIOUS.

Need a date place or a cute restaurant for a ladies night? Come here! It's a cozy little Italian place right off State Street (so parking isn't great.) The service is always friendly (they helped me pair my wine to the dish I was ordering) but the food is even better! They bring complimentary bread for the table which is warm & amazing. My friend and I got the appetizer sampler which comes with bruschetta, calamari, and caprese - 3 of my favorites and perfect size for sharing. The house side salad was less than $4 so we of course got that to balance our "treat yourself" meal. I've had multiple of their pastas (all great), but my favorite is their signature dish - the Tutto Pasta: bowtie pasta sauteed with onions, mushrooms, chicken, and a red cream sauce.

Was traveling to Madison on business and wanted some Italian food that was close to the hotel. Had a seat at the bar and ordered a house salad with ranch and the chicken parm dinner with penne in their blush sauce on the side. For dessert I had the cheesecake. There was nothing special about the meal and the chicken parm was loaded with marinara sauce. The cheesecake was tasty and portions were huge. The bartender was great but the staff was sitting next to me at the bar so I felt like I was an intruder while they hung out.

Some colleagues and I are visiting Madison for a conference, and we decided to stop in here for lunch. So glad we did, both pastas and Parmesan chicken sandwich we ordered were delicious! Next time we are in Madison we will be back.

We just visited Tutto's this past Labor Day on Monday.  We had 8 people in our dinner party.  Upon entering we came into a smaller but cozy bar area, some stools and some booths facing State Street.  Everything was full, that's a good sign.  We were soon seated upstairs.  Our table of eight had a nice view overlooking the sidewalks of State Street.  Since we were their for lunch we mostly took advantage of the lunch specials.  The basket of warm bread and dipping oil is wonderful.  Careful not to eat too much!  All the food was wonderful and plenty of it.  Enough to take home for another meal.  Service was good (however one side salad was missed) and the price point was very good off the lunch special menu.
Worst Penne Arribiatta ever, tons of anchovies, all I could taste was anchovies and salt, the dish had no balance. No one greets you at the door. Better food at the Noodles chain across the street.

It deserves a better rating. I crave for pasta as an 100% italian and this place does his job. Cheap, casual service in a not fancy place. Pasta is cooked right and both times I enjoyed all my meal. Penne Diavolo and Arrabbiata were spicy with a nice tomato and garlic sauce. Sure, nothing to do with the legit italian cuisine, but much better than many fake fancy expensive restaurant where they use the word ITALIAN just to charge an extra 30% on junk food. As a pasta lover, and away from home I can go for lunch all week. Give it a go.

Went here with two other couples.  One couple had special diet needs and the server was very knowledgeable wand worked with the chef.  The service overall was fantastic and our dishes were fantastic.  The deserts weren't as good as we hoped but it wouldn't keep us from visiting again.  I would recommend reservations.

Had a rough experience tonight. Went to dinner in a group of 8. They seated us downstairs. Food was served. I ordered the risotto. Honestly the worst restaurant risotto I've ever had in my life. Chunks of onion and sauce made no sense at all. That's wasn't even the worst part. Towards the end of our dinner the ceiling above us caved in and dumped water all over someone in our party. I am not kidding.
They were nice enough to add an extra bottle of wine and comp my friends dinner which got soaked with who knows what kind of water. 
Had memories of this place from college but this was bad. The food is Ragu quality. I know this seems harsh, but the fact that the ceiling literally caved in on us tells you all you need to know about what the current management cares about. Outside of being in downtown Madison you would be better served going to Olive Garden.

Large portions. If you want to get large portions of something, yup, here's the place to go.

Drinks. mehhh. Seafood, please please please avoid it. Meat, alright. Veg, ok. 

The only nice part of Tutto Pasta was that they had a nice area on the second floor for anyone interested in small parties. 

Pasta seems too oily and lack of flavor. 

Really surprised at how popular it actually is, always see people at the bar and at the window seats 0.0

I mean, it's decent Italian.

I used to come here as a kid all the time. This was probably my favorite restaurant, until I realized that other Italian restaurants besides Olive Garden existed too. It's a step up from like Biaggi's and Benvenuto's in my personal opinion, but nothing that wowed.

First thing I have say is that those red pepsi cups threw the meal off. I know I'm not usually one to complain about decor, but I would expect like those red cups to come from a buffet or something (and we weren't offered straws either). This was like a full on, rustic, brick wall ambience place so at least something like a normal glass of water should've sufficed.

Many years ago I got the Tutto Pasta and Calamari; both pretty decent dishes. From what I remember, the Tutto Pasta was nice and rich but not overdone. The calamari was well seasoned. They were still a little pricey for the simplistic flavors, though.

The night I'm mostly reviewing about is when I got the Fettuccine al Limone. The dish itself did not look appetizing; the sauce was almost a grey-brown. The garnish (either mint or parsley, I forget) looked a bit wilted, and was sloppily gashed onto the plate.

I have to commend this dish, however, on the flavor, which is obviously the most important part of the experience. It tasted rich but not overwhelming, and the lemon flavor came through well. My one problem with this dish? The chicken deserved 2 stars. Boring, poorly seasoned, dry overcooked chicken did not impress. For a $13.95 dish, I would have at least expected the chicken to taste good with the rest of the dish.

Overall, this place has some hits and some misses. Definitely found the chicken to be underwhelming, although maybe that was just a one-time thing/kitchen consistency issue. I'll be back with absolutely no complaints if I'm dragged here (like I was this time), but I probably won't go out of my way to eat here again.

We tried Tutto Pasta on a recommendation from the front desk staff at our hotel. The pasta was okay. I had spaghetti bolognese. My wife had penne pasta with vodka sauce. I've had better. Our server was nice, but she seemed overwhelmed. We asked for more bread and never got it. We asked for cheese to top our pasta and that took a while. Finally, we ordered dessert. I ordered creme brulee and my wife had chocolate cow cheesecake. My wife said her cheesecake was too sweet. The creme brulee was the worst I've had. It was warm, the top was too burnt, it was bright yellow and had a floury consistency. I'd skip Tutto Pasta. There are better options in Madison.

One of the few Italian restaurants in the State Street area , however not worth the price.  I've gone multiple times and tried a few things on the menu (pasta and sauce; chicken parm; etc.).  Was not impressed with any meal.  Further, the restaurant is rather cramped and difficult to move around. Would suggest looking for other restaurants in Madison if you're looking for Italian.

I wouldn't say the food is anything to write home about but we had a very large party and the eagerly accommodated us on an already busy evening. The server didn't mess up a single order, and the door came out in a timely manner. Salad leaves a lot to be desired, I wouldn't order it again. I had the chicken Parm and it was good. I enjoyed it. Will go back again when in town for a race.
OK food but they randomly close early.  Went at 8:20 PM on a weekday (they are "open" until 9) and they said they were closed.  And there was an electric sign in the window that said "Open".  Idiots.
Eh.  Not really that good.  The chicken wasn't well trimmed, and the pasta was nothing special.  I'll skip it in the future.

The pasta had a good bite.  The bread was fresh, but the guy spilled olive oil on the table (and one of us).  We were not offered parmesan,  but most people were from what I saw.  All and all I think it's probably better than this first experience showed.   I'll try it again.

Is the Alfredo sauce just melted butter? That's what it looks/tastes like. Absolutely no seasoning or flavor on the sauces. I didn't see one peice of tomato in the clear greasy tomato sauce either. You can find a better recipe for sauce on the Internet, and they should too.

Also, servers all crowd by the bar and talk to each other while we run out of water and olive oil for our bread. Hard workers.

For a downtown restaurant, I hoped to leave happy, not with leftovers I will reluctantly take a bite of due to hunger but throw away after.

Having dined at this establishment a handful of times, my boyfriend and I always had very pleasant dinning experiences... until tonight. I kept hoping that maybe, just maybe, it was some horrible April Fool's Day joke that our waiter was playing on us, but alas it was just downright horrible service. I'll begin with the good though:
Every time I've dined at Tutto, I have tried a new dish, and have never disliked any of the dishes I have tried. My favorite appetizers are their calamari (beware the dipping sauce has a kick to it) and the mozzarella square (not sure what it's actually called). Entree wise, I have tried dishes from the manicotti, to the fettuccine Alfredo, to the tortellini, to their signature Tutto pasta dish. It always tastes AMAZING. The portions are very generous and well worth their cost. Also, the food generally comes out rather quickly, which I quite enjoy. I have yet to try their desserts, however I caught a glance at the tiramisu tonight and if I had any room left in my tummy after dinner, I would have jumped on that. Even the free warm bread and oil/balsamic spread is tasty.

So what was so bad about our experience that even such yummy food couldn't make up for the crappy service? 
Prior to leaving for the restaurant, we knew that there was a good chance it would be busy and so we made a reservation online which I highly recommend anyone to do. We made ours at 7:30 for 8pm and it worked out very well! Ideally though, you should probably make this a little more in advanced for the restaurants sake. Any who, we were seated promptly and our server took our drink orders and the bussers handed out our bread and spread and water glasses. All was fine and dandy. Then, when not immediately ready to order, the waiter took a ridiculous amount of time to come back and place our order. At the time, we made nothing of it, it was still pretty busy in the place after all. Fast forward a bit and we are enjoying our meals. As per usually, our waiter stopped on by briefly to ask how everything tasted. That was the last time we conversed with him for what felt like forever. After clearly finishing our meal, we watched him walk past our table numerous times to acknowledge all the other tables around us, except us. My boyfriend even made eye contact with him while he was just standing around, and still, nothing. At this point, I decided to make the universal signal that hey, we're done with our meal by placing my napkin from my lap onto the table. Nothing. Then, I noticed that the table next to us, a group of 3 adults probably in their late 30's had not only received their meal, but had also had their plates taken away and been offered dessert by the same waiter that we had, ALL WHILE WE WERE STILL WAITING FOR HIM TO EVEN OFFER US A STINKING TO-GO BOX. Not only did he do this to just that one table, but the two tables behind us who were also groups of 4 or more, and older more well-established adults. At this point, my boyfriend and I determined that he was clearly sucking up to these people for the tips, and discriminating against us because we clearly look like young college kids. While I wanted to leave the waiter a brutal note acknowledging who incredibly rude he was for the treatment we received as well as leave a poor tip, I restrained myself. Just because I'm a college kid, does not mean I do not tip, or tip poorly. In fact, we left him more than a 20% tip because once my boyfriend was finally wave him over for the check, we just didn't want to play the waiting game all damn night and wait for him to give us change. Yes, there are people in my generation who don't fully prepare a proper tip at restaurants, but that doesn't mean all of us don't, nor should we have been ignored because of this. 

So, while I love the food and ambiance at this establishment, I cannot give my money to a business that treats its customers like this in the future. We both felt incredibly disrespected during this experience and wouldn't wish it upon anyone else. I do hope that you give them a try, and that your waiter/waitress is more kind and respectful than the one we had. Who am I to say that one bad experience of mine should stop others from trying this place? However, I do feel that this experience does need to be out there for others to hear about and maybe even by the restaurant owners themselves so this doesn't happen to anyone in the future.
Very nice place. They have a full bar, the service was fast and friendly as was the food. I ordered the ravioli alfredo and it was delicious. I would recommend here to anyone.

Tutto is that sad restaurant that tries to mask its sad food with table cloths and cloth napkins and those little glass candles. Most people who have tried good Italian food know not to return here. Yes we have pathetic Italian options in Madison but if you're craving Italian, get some great RP pasta and cook it at home; it'll take less time for better flavor than going to Tutto. I've been here a few times due to others' requests. I think Noodles and Co. wins. At least the pasta has never been soggy but there's nothing I've been impressed with. 

I've tried pizza, pasta, and salmon. The pizza was okay, the salmon was dry, the pasta is pasta. 

I remember the first time I came in here in college and ordered a pasta with chicken in it. The chicken seemed like it was that rubbery defrosted chicken with fake grill marks that Tyson has, and it's probably served in prisons and awful cafeterias. This is one of the reasons I became vegetarian. 

The alcohol is a mess. Most of their martinis are Smirnoff vodka based. I went safe and went with one of their cheap red wines.

I ate here with a friend when we were in town for a weekend. I had special ravioli (heart shaped) that had a great tomato-based cream sauce. My friend got a ricotta/spinach pasta dish. The food was good and it was fun to sit outside and people watch in the nice weather. We also had champagne cocktails for Mother's Day--they tasted good but I don't think there was much alcohol in there. That's fine, but they were pricey considering.

I thoroughly enjoyed this place! I came on a Friday night and just at the right time as behind me started a line of people. This cute little corner restaurant has a great story (highlighted on the front of their menu) and even cuter internal setup. It's 2 stories and even with the low ceilings there is just a great amount of charm that this place has to offer. 

Fresh warm focaccia bread, olive oil and balsamic with some fresh cracked pepper.. yum. New specials on a separate page, with fresh ingredients and just Italian charm. 

The portions here are quite large, so save some room in your stomach if you're coming here or think about sharing a plate and an appetizer. I got the tutto drew, added some mushrooms, and was VERY happy with the dish. 

it was perfectly cooked al dente and with the addition of some fresh Parmesan from the server and some red pepper flakes, I couldn't have asked for a better dish. The sausage had a good texture and you could taste the splash of wine, but still enjoy the creaminess of the red sauce. By the time we were done, this place was still packed and more people were coming in. I would totally be down to try any of the other dishes on this menu or just come for a cute little date night on state street. 

happy bowtie pasta eating!

Quick and friendly service, tasty food, and an adorable ambiance makes for a great experience at Tutto each and every time. 

I always order the Tutto Pasta - bowtie pasta sauteed with onions, mushrooms, chicken, with a light tomato cream sauce. Trust me, it is insanely good. There is just no way you could ever be disappointed with this dish. Plus it usually (sometimes) lasts for 2 meals which is always a plus. 

Not a huge fan of their bread they serve before the meal but i still can't help but grab a piece. I mean it's just sitting right in front of me...

Stopped in on a Friday for lunch while wandering on State street.  The inside could use a spruce up for sure, but the wait staff was very friendly and attentive.  The menu had a large selection and plenty to choose from for me, being GF.  I originally was leaning toward a salad as several looked great, but after talking to our server I went with a GF pasta and they made a GF cream sauce for it..the pasta and sauce were quite good ( this is not something I bother making myself at home), however the chicken in the dish was clearly a reheated precooked breast and the mushrooms were paper-thin and scant.  I would give my dish 3 stars because although not awesome, I appreciated the effort to make a cream-based GF dish.  My 13 year old daughter LOVED the complimentary bread and her Ravioli Alfredo and gave hers a 5 star, so we compromised on an overall 4 star.

Tutto Pasta is a pretty decent Italian restaurant. As I am quite the sucker for Italian, I've been here a fair share of times. 

My favorite thing about Tutto Pasta is that the portions are huge. To me, the more, the merrier! I love the tutto pasta dish, the lasagna, and both the meat and vegetarian calzones. Their pizzas are okay, but aren't as filling, so I wouldn't recommend getting pizza at Tutto Pasta (after all, there's an Ian's and a Pizza Di Roma on the same street).

Going in large groups isn't always the best idea. But service isn't bad, and the free bread is always a good gig.

I went here with a group on a busy Friday night before the Madison Mini Marathon. Needless to say, the place was crowded full of people, and even walking through the front door was a bit of challenge. Once we got to our seats, our waitress was kind and helpful and skillfully managed the drink and food orders of a table of 16 people. She even had us all pay individually at her kiosk, which helped save time from giving everyone their cheque separately. 

Being that I was running a half marathon the next morning, I ordered conservatively and went with the spaghetti and meatballs. While it wasn't terrible, it was uninspiring. There was very little sauce on it at all, the meatballs didn't have much of a flavour either. After I took the first bite, I was left thinking to myself that I've made spaghetti better myself with frozen meatballs at the grocery store and a jar of Ragu. Perhaps had I ordered something more involved on the menu I would've had a better experience, but the fact that they whiffed on such an easy dish makes it unlikely that I will return any time soon.

I ended up going here another time, and I ordered the chicken parm, which is one of their specials. It was delicious! I think if you order from their favourites there is a better chance of getting something yummy.

We were a little disappointed with this visit :(. Usually the bread basket is excellent. Crunchy crusty bread... Today was left over Pani bread.  Glorified white bread... Bummer.  Rigatoni Norma was also disappointing.  A dish that should be cooked together to blend ingredients and flavors was created by what seemed to be assembly line preparation.  Eggplant was prediced and then added to the dish.  The cheese, which defines the dish, should have been pecorino romano cheese, but sadly it was just mozzarella.  :(.  No offer to add additional parmesan cheese....  Not a good visit.
.

I can not fully express my LOVE of Tutto Pasta. We have been here many many times and never been disappointed. Several times (almost always actually) we have had the same waiter ( Arod) and I'm convinced he makes alllll the difference. 

The food is also outstanding. I usually get the Penne Quatro Formaggio (soooo good) and  my husband gets many different seafood and pasta dishes. All of their pasta is homemade and made to order, in my opinion also the best in town!!

Was really hoping this would be good. My wife and I just went for Valentines Day and the warm bread was very hard, the Calamari tasteless, the Bruschetta drowning in tomatoes with old useless bits of Basil, and no taste. Our clam/mussel/fish dish had ONE clam and ONE mussel.  The Sangiovese wine is actually a poor CabSav and Sangiovese blend - I asked to see the bottle. We were disappointed. It was, for us, not a good experience. Our waiter did a fine job, not his fault. Will never go back.
Awesome spot. We split a pasta dish because the portions are huge!  A super wide variety of pastas on the menu so lots of great options to choose from.

I think people have been a little harsh and probably not all that honest about this place, in my opinion it's the best italian food I've ever had and I'm a fat man so I've had lots of italian.  Their whole menu is actually based around pasta instead of silly italianized chicken and steaks and pizza and crap and it's all authentic and well prepared.  My server was no genius but he was certainly competant enough and doesn't deserve to be put down just because he was a student.  I think it's great that they'd hire and help out students, better than working at taco bell.  It is romantic inside to an extent but not entirely with the huge windows that face state street as everyone walking by can see your foot caressing your wifes.  Keep your hands to yourself if you are sitted by the window and enjoy the grade A pasta.

Not sure what the deal on the other reviews are, we thought the food here was great, and the service on a Monday afternoon was just fine.  We had the chicken parmigiana and rigatoni pino.  Both of which were good, although the chicken on the rigatoni wasn't as good as the parmigiana.  The bread they brought out as an appetizer was awesome.

I was excited to go here because I love pasta. I ordered the rigatoni pecorara, and I was very unimpressed. It tasted very bland and I didn't even finish it. Maybe it was just this dish that wasn't flavorful because I tried my friends dish, which was a pesto pasta, and I liked that one much more. 

I came here for a big bachelorette and bachelor dinner - we had maybe more than 20 people and the staff were very attentive and did a great job taking care of us!

Long regarded as one of the best places for a fabulous meal on Madison's State Street, our visit there on a Friday after work affirmed their well-deserved reputation precedent. We were able to get seated in a timely manner even though we didn't have reservations, and our window seat afforded ample opportunities to take in the campus nighttime hustle and flow. The Spaghetti AI Frutti Di Mare was full of tasteful zest with ample seafood and the Pizza Salsiccia was light and lively. two thumbs, way up!

We recently discovered this spot and quickly realized this was a favorite for many. Lots of students were getting takeout and the restaurant quickly filled up fast. We had the Sangria (which was delicious) and two really good meals. We will be back!
Nothing special, my pasta had mussels in it and they were extremely fishy and didn't taste fresh, the server was rude and short with us. Won't be back again.

The food is great, though I've had a number of delivery orders messed up or canceled after the fact.

I very much recommend eating in at Tutto, but I would suggest taking delivery or take-out business elsewhere.

Calamari was amazing, like melt in your mouth good. Some of the best I've ever had. 
I was dull and had a chicken Cesar but it was good. Both kids liked their chicken and spaghetti and my husbands Italian sandwich, while food, lacked any real Italian flavors.

We we're looking for an authentic Italian eatery and Tuttos did not disappoint. Our waitress was fantastic. The bread is top notch. I had minestrone soup to start, yum! He had a house salad, the homemade Italian dressing was great. My pasta was delicious and his chicken picata was yummy. Not sure why it has a 3 star rating! The manager was also very nice.
Average tasting food. Also badly managed service kept us at the table for too long. We had to wait for about 40 mins only to get our orders taken and served with water.

To be honest, I'm pretty picky with Italian cuisine just because I've grown up with amazing homemade fair from my Italian American family. 

Pros:

1. Noodles were al dente and tasted fresh
2. Huge menu with lots of specials
3. Large portions at a decent price

Cons:

1. Table bread tasted like old hot dog buns
2. Service was slow (but friendly)
3. Pasta had a decent flavor but nothing I'd dream about getting in the future. 
4. There! Were! Exclamation! Points! Everywhere! It was a little discombobulating -- from the signs on the doors to information on the menu. Someone is either very angry or very enthusiastic. Or both?

With so many other culinary options in Madison, I'd be hardpressed to venture here on the regular.

You won't have a terrible meal at Tutto, but you won't have an outstanding one either.  Overall, it's a solid choice if you're on State Street and feel like Italian in an outdoor cafe.

The pizza had potential, but it came with too much cheese and not quite hot enough.  The chicken parm would have fit in well at the Olive Garden.  The pene in red sauce was good but the portion was enough for two-plus.

Overall a solid three star, possibly a four if you're going through a bottle of wine and sitting outside on a pleasant evening.

Love it, but be prepared to be surrounded by freshman on first dates...this place is THE place for the looking for love college crowd.  For something a little more intimate....check out the one on the other side of the capitol.  You can't go wrong here...huge portions and very flavorful.  I love the pesto and chicken!  I am reserving my 5 stars for the other Tutto.....3 stars.
We stumbled upon this place when going to a show at the Overture center. The chicken Marsala and lasagna were absolutely delicious!! Very reasonable prices for great food. We will be back very soon!

We enjoyed Tutto Pasta Trattoria on a Saturday for lunch. We walked in and were instantly seated, I was surprised by this as State Street was a mess because of it being the first day of the farmers market and there was an Earth Day conference at Monona Terrace. 

The service was okay, I know a gasp right? Our server didn't seem very interested in helping us... We mentioned we'd never been there. She didn't take that "ping" and just asked if she could get us a drink. We ordered a vodka lemonade, alfredo ravioli, Chicken sandwich panini, and a coca cola. 

The sandwich was great, the chicken was well seasoned and the veggies were good the bread was delicious! The raviolis were good and and had some size to them. The oils for the bread were a little strong for my tastes though. 

If the service was better I would give this place 5 stars... Also the tables seemed a little crammed in this place. If your large I'd consider going elsewhere. Overall food was good, service was meh, setting was inviting "minus the crammed but cozy space."

This is where 19 year olds go for their first date or Valentine's Day (a boyfriend took me here for my 19th birthday in fact).  If you are over the age of 19, however, it's time to learn that dinners can be fancy even if not consumed at an Italian restaurant and so it's time to "wow" your date with something much more interesting than boring, overpriced food here.  In fact, show them how "cultured" you are and try Kabul, Husnus, or Chatara- all with much better food for the same price (or possibly cheaper) and all within a block of this knock-off of Fazolis.

Bread is amazing, everything else is just okay fake Italian food. 

Portion are way too large, Id rather pay $5 less for a normal size. 

If you are looking for an Americanized Italian restaurant, this is it. Dishes are equivalent to Olive Garden except you pay more here.

I keep hearing about their amazing clam pasta, but I don't think that actually exists anymore... Sigh!

Tutto is excellently located for pre-Overture center dinner, and they take reservations! So I've been there a couple of times before a show. The atmosphere is standard "Italian." The food is good, but it's not necessarily creative. It's got all your favorite staples (Alfredo! Red sauce!) and a good set of options in those sauces. They have some different pasta options too--whole wheat, omega 3, etc etc. Worth it! Large portions, a little on the expensive side, but generally a good time.

I've been going to this place since I moved to Madison 13 years ago.  Their food is very good, I can't fault them for that.

What I do fault them for is the atmosphere.  Namely, the proximity of every table to the other tables.  I've always noticed the dinning room is crowded, and the tables and chairs are wobbly.  In the past, my stepmother has even asked for different chairs.

Last time we went there (prob three years ago) my husband and I were seated upstairs, at a table between two other tables which were abutting the walls.  There was not more than 8 inches between our table and the one on either side of us.  A waiter had to squeeze through several times to get to the tables close to the window before we were even waited on.  That was enough for me.  We left., which I felt awful about, but it was just ridiculous.  Better for them to have left that table out that we were sitting at than to leave it there for the extra revenue. 

Bottom line: very good food, just can't stand the crowdedness of the place.  Not sure if crowdedness is a word, but you know what I mean ;)

So disappointed. Ordered shrimp fettuccine alfredo and I all I got was a watered down Alfredo with 5 pieces of shrimp for $16. Olive Garden in comparison sadly is 100x better and it comes with a soup or salad and you get seafood Alfredo which is creamy and you definitely get more bang for your buck. I wish I could complain directly to them but I can't even locate the website. Disappointment at the least.

The three of us were strolling down State Street.  We we looking for Italian.  We came across Tutto Pasta and decided to give it a try.  A very nice gentleman greeted us and showed us to a booth.  We were brought bread and olive oil.  A lot of places serve oxidized oil.  Not here, the oil tasted very fresh. We all got pasta dishes.  My companions (my wife and her friend) got noodle dishes, which they enjoyed very much.  I got manicotti.  It was rich, creamy and delicious.  Some of the best I've had in a while.  The marinara sauce was outstanding, they have to make it themselves.  Our waiter was very cool and friendly, checking in to see if we were happy.  Another thing I liked about the service is that our waiter noticed we were finished and brought our tab quickly.  We enjoyed our visit and left happy and satisfied.  This is definitely a restaurant you would want to patronize as the food and service were really good.  I highly recommend Tutto Pasta.  Just watch that step getting up to your booth.

Their food is unbelievably average for the prices that they charge.  Their food sounds appetizing, but always comes out to be a pretty regular pasta dish.  No wow factor, nothing intriguing or interesting.  It's a step up from your fast food italian, but not much more.  Seriously, for good Italian, go to Osteria Papavero.  Slightly pricier at Osteria, but the food is significantly better than Tutto Pasta.   

Their bread is fair, but I've had better.  They're pretty good with large groups though.  The menu selection is huge and so vegetarians and meatarians can find something to their fancy.  This is also why I went back several times.  I kept hoping to find something I enjoyed but after 6 or 7 times, I've given up on those pipe dreams.

Let me preface this by saying that my two previous experiences have been positive, which is why I came back a third time for a birthday dinner before a performance at the overture. 

This time, however, my party of 3 was extremely disappointed. We got sat upstairs in the booths that look into State st, right in front of the bar as well as the hostess stand. We did not get any service for 15 minutes, at which point we went up to the bar to order a drink. Bartender ignored us. Sat back down and asked the host who would be serving us. He said he would send someone over and was so sorry for the wait. Another 15 minutes go by and we finally get acknowledged by the bartender/waiter with, "I'll be right with you." Comes back after another 10 minutes later to take our dinner and drink order. We wait. And wait. Finally our food arrives about an hour in, which isn't terrible for a busy Saturday night, but the food arrived before our drinks!!! All we ordered were 3 pomegranate Martinis. At this point, my food is on the table, and I go up to the bar a third time to remind them of our drink order. I watched the bartender fill two other drink orders prior to filling ours and I stood at the counter to wait for him to finish our drinks. Food was decent, albeit a little cold since I waited at the bar while my food was on the table, but we could not believe the slow and terrible service we received this night.

Pretty good Italian food! I'd recommend the penne Quattro fromaggio. Their bread also had a distinct sweetness that, when combined with vinegar and oil, is incredibly delicious. Their tutto pasta is also great, and I like to get it with extra veggies. They do a good job with calamari, too. They have a delicious Italian margarita that will be sure to get you buzzed if that's what you're up for. Just wish that the seating wasn't so cramped, however they are in pretty tight quarters in the location and the crowd that it amasses.

So just like the Southwest commercials I just had to get away.  So, I got in my rental and headed to Madison.  I ended up at Tutto Pasta Trattoria on State Street.  I like the windows as I walked by and decided to go in.  The place was a lot more narrow that I thought.  I took a place at the bar.  I enjoyed a nice glass of wine and really good pasta dish.  The portions are wayyy to big.  I mean if I had been a plus 1 we could have eaten my one dish. 

The staff was nice but I could see how they could become too comfortable.  The environment is just comfortable and welcomes groups that stay well after the food has been eaten.

Not sure if I will come back to Madison, WI but if I do I will definitely come back to this place.

I really love this place! I love the atmosphere and decoration. It's such a cute place with the little lights hanging on the windows. You could come here for any occasion: fun with friends, family outing, birthdays, romantic date. It really caters to all! When coming here, I see people in cocktail dresses and suits, and others in a tshirt and jeans. The food is always spot on (fresh pasta!) and the staff is very friendly. I came once while it was busy and we were stuck in the back by the dish room. Turns out, anyone who has to sit at that table back there gets a free desert! That was a nice surprise and was very accommodating. All in all, I definitely recommend!

Pros - Food was made very very fast, we ordered and started eating in no more than 5-8 minutes. Very decent portion, I had to box 40% of it home 

Cons - I've had better pasta. On menu everything looks great but the food came on a common looking oval dinner plate, which made the food looked even more bland than it already was, like *almost* something that came out of a can, same can be said for the taste

Overall - 

Food - Nothing great. I ordered the Tutto Pasta, bowtie in red pasta sauce with a bit of chicken, a bit of mushroom and not a lot of anything else, the sauce was more orange than red, nothing stood out from the dish

Price - For the price you pay ($15 tips included for 1 dish of pasta and water), you can definitely find something else better on State St.

Service - Average

This is a great place for Italian food on State St! There are A LOT of options to choose from, the portions are big so there is always leftovers, it is reasonably priced and the service is great! There is outdoor seating on State St and two levels inside so there is never really a wait for a table. They are also dog-friendly (for outdoor seating). It is a nice option instead of an Italian chain restaurant.

When I first started going to Tuttos years ago I loved it. The service was great, the sauce on the pasta was rich. But the last few times I've gone I've been disappointed. Last night my boyfriend and I went and it was very busy. I figured we would have to wait a few minutes but instead they placed us upstairs at a table in a dark corner...no server helped us for at least 10 minutes after sitting down. once we were finally helped the service did speed up a bit but that seemed to be because they wanted to move customers out as quick as possible. The food wasn't terrible but it wasn't anything special. We won't return.

First time at Tutto Pasta, been eyeing it for a while and today was the day I finally had a chance to grab a bite from this place. I give it about a 3 out of 5. Nothing special here, I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. The dish was a bit dull and I couldn't even taste the garlic because there didn't appear to be any. The noodles were not al dente and I had to add salt. My daughter always says, "If they have salt at the table, it's not a legit Italian place." In this case, they had salt at the table and they definitely needed it. My daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs, it needed some salt, as well. I will say that it's a step up from Olive Garden and definitely doesn't have the chain feeling. However, if you want good Italian food, try Lombardinos on Univeristy Ave.

Good quality Italian for the State St. area. Comfy booths (there's also outdoor seating), nice decor, good weekly lunch specials. I can't really say much else that would separate them from a typical Italian restaurant. Good deals on wine; liked their house wine. Enjoyed the olive oil they served with their crusty bread.

This place is a pretty good Italian spot. 

The food: 

Mozzarella in Carrozza appetizer was fantastic. More cheese, less bread compared to breadsticks, which is a win. But what really made it shine is the home made marinara sauce. Some of the best marinara I've ever tasted. 

I am a huge fan of clam linguine. I asked the server if he had any recommendations for me, and he suggested a spicy clam linguine that was absolutely the best clam linguine I've had (and that's saying a lot!). Definitely coming back for it. 

The house special tutto pasta was quite bland for our taste. Would not recommend it. In hindsight, we should have ordered something with the marinara sauce- because it was fantastic on the appetizer. 

Judging by our experience, and other yelp reviews, this menu is really hit or miss. So make sure you read the dish descriptions carefully, and when in doubt opt for the marinara dish (or if you like seafood, the odd menu clam linguine)

The atmosphere: 

As good as it's going to get on state street. They did a good job giving a place an Italian feel, despite the difficulty of being on state street. The bar area is loud and cold in the winter (of course it is- it's by the door and they play the games, as they should). First floor dining is a bit crammed- but second floor is pretty good! Plenty of elbow room, quieter, with decent decor. They did the best they could with the space, and it turned out alright.

I ordered the Tutto Drew with mushrooms, which was a red sauce pasta with sausage and onions, and I thought it was fantastic. Perfect portion size and overall delicious. The waiting staff was extremely friendly and helpful and brought a free tiramisu, which was actually one of the best I'd ever had.

I've had really good food here and also really blah food. The service, prices, and portions are good, but the food is inconsistent. Some things are delicious and very flavorful, and others are really bland. I haven't figured out the pattern.

We made reservations for 5:00, as we were told they were completely booked from 5:30-8:00. I won't lie, when you are seated at your table and there are plenty of open tables, it's disheartening to have to eat earlier than you had anticipated (we had tickets for a show at Overture). Having been sat in a nearly empty restaurant it is equally disheartening to have your server rush around and make you feel like you need to eat and move. 
However, once the rush came we were left alone for longer periods of time which then made the experience much more enjoyable. Our server was actually quite knowledgeable and extremely patient with extensive food requests due to an allergy and never showed annoyance. 
The food was so delicious! Our table ordered a pizza, the tutto pasta, and two orders of the lobster ravioli (one with tomato cream sauce, one with vodka sauce). The lobster ravioli is a perfect portion size while the others could easily be split between two people. The bread basket was warm and fresh, and we had offers to replenish it. We will definitely be returning!

I got the chicken parm and it may have been the worst chicken parm i have ever eaten. The chicken was so bad i couldn't even finish it. Up the street is chain restaurant noodles and company which has better food at a cheaper price than tuttos. That should not be the case. Tuttos should be a step up in quality as well not just in price.

I wavered between 3 and 4 stars on this one.  If I go back and it's good under different circumstances, I'll probably upgrade to 4 stars.

We went on Christmas Eve with a party of five, including me, my wife, my daughter, and my in-laws.  We were seated pretty much immediately, as the restaurant was only inhabited by a handful of regulars and a couple of other parties.  We actually had the whole upstairs area to ourselves, which is good, because sometimes the kiddo gets cranky, and while you don't want to never eat in a restaurant, you also don't want to disturb people.  Anyway.

To start: the food was very good.  I'll speak to the quality of the bread, which was really good. The pasta itself was well-cooked, and didn't fall into the floppy and limp trap.  If I could find something to pick nits about, the sauce was a bit watery.

Two main complaints prevent this from being a higher rating for me:

1.  This place is small and kind of irregularly shaped, and I don't think it would be nearly as fun if it were crowded.  I think tables are a little on top of each other, and it would get tight and probably hot.  I don't want to have to avoid a place for this reason, but I'm afraid it would be a complication later on.

2.  Dealing with our server was really frustrating.  She didn't know the answers to any of the reasonable questions we had about the dishes and specials, and she couldn't explain the wine taster special that was going on for the night.  The service was on the whole unremarkable.

I can deal with other difficulties if there's exceptional food, or sacrifice amazing food for outstanding service and a great experience.  Tutto Pasta is a good place, but it doesn't get to a really level in either of those areas.

I was a little worried about going here after checking out the other reviews. Someone else set up a group dinner here for 12 of us, so what could I do, right ? Well I went in here expecting the worst and wound up pleasantly surprised. 

The place was kind of a tight fit for 12, strange shaped rooms and what not, but whatever. The staff was attentive and stayed on top of everything we needed, bread, keeping drinks filled, whatever. 

The food was OK, we tried a few different appetizers, all decent. The spaghetti carbonara was a a bit on the bland side, nothing some crushed red pepper couldn't take care of. 

So over all, not great, but not terrible either.
It was a great place for some beers, coffee and dessert.  The waitress was a sweetheart.  Good hard working college kid. The cannoli didn't taste like a NJ or NY cannoli so that was as bummer.

Meh, it was decent food.  I think a bit overpriced for ambience, quality and service.  Overall was good though.  I was a little disappointed when I asked the server for a recommendation and he only mentioned the most expensive thing on the menu, and my meal wasn't better than the others.  The server was kind though and the timing of the food was great.

Great atmosphere and location.  We had a large party and the drinks were taking a while because of it.  It happens, and the server was great so I didn't mind going up to the bar for a drink waiting for service to catch up.

I asked for an orange vodka (goose or ketel) on the rocks from Raul the bartender who didn't know what products he had.  He finally found a smirnoff orange and poured me 2 on the rocks.  I had asked for an orange vodka with 2 rocks.  My bad for not saying ice, I guess.  I drank them both.

I asked him which wine was dryer, the chianti or Sangiovese and he started to pour me a taste of the cab which I pointed out wasn't a Sangiovese or chianti.  I spotted carmenere and ordered that.  When I got the bar tab it said 2 absolute instead of smirnoff.  I asked him if he could adjust the check and he said there was no button for smirnoff and he couldn't adjust the price.  Really Raul?  There's no smirnoff button?  And Absolute and smirnoff are not in the same price range.  Fine, I paid and went back to my party.  

Frutti di Mare was bland and the pasta wasn't drained well so it was watery.  2 more who had pasta said theirs was Bland as well.  Caesar salad was fine, unmemorable. Good wine by the glass list.  Waitress was friendly and competent, and very busy.  No manager was ever present.

Curious, I asked her if there was a button in the aloha system that they used to order smirnoff.  There was and she said raul was the manager.  Awesome.  Clearly an unloved restaurant.  If anyone cared in the restaurant, about the food or service, I never met them.  My wish is the economy would fail more of these passionless restaurants so some new vibrant restaurants with passionate restauranteurs would emerge.

We've been here over 10 times, each time worse than the previous time. Their pasta is pretty good, but everything else isn't great. It's loud, crowded, and the staff is incredibly unorganized. On one occasion we made reservations, waited for them to clear a table, only for them to give our table away to a walk in. We had to wait another 20 min. On another occasion we waited 20min for an outdoor table to be available, see a table open up and then a couple that just walked in be seated at that table. We told the "hostess" and they said they're sorry and would let us know when another one opened. 
My biggest complaint is the outdoor seating dog policy - We have been here with our 2 dogs, 3 times, and had the same waiter each time. We brought them about a month ago, the same waiter told us dogs have never been allowed, even when I said they've been with us before. It's one thing if the policy changed, but it was insinuated that they were never there. I'm not quite sure why you would refuse to seat dog owners outside. This really bothered me as it's the only restaurant that doesn't allow dogs outside, and the outdoor "patio" is on the very busy sidewalk on state street.
It seems like the quality has been slowly decline over the last 2 years. It's a shame because I used to like going here but I don't think we will be coming back.

Just an awesome place. I go here all the time and it just has the best sauce. Even a basic spaghetti is just great. The sauce has a very nice sweet taste that's just truly amazing. Totally recommend noodles with pesto sauce. Something you'll never forget. Service is awesome with very nice people. This place is just a solid five stars.

I ordered a carbonara dish with pancetta. I received overcooked pasta with a HEAP of halfway cooked american bacon mixed into it. It was legitamitely one of the worst italian meals I've ever had. How is it even possible to mess up such a simple dish?! AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!

I am not a fan. The Italian fare here is pretty basic, and the dishes are generally underwhelming. Tutto charges like a mid-range to fine dining Italian restaurant, while the quality of the food reminds me much more of a quick "fast food" Italian place, such as Noodles and Company. 

The pastas I've had which include meat and vegetables, in particular, lack freshness. The vegetables taste old, and the meat is usually overcooked or just tastes of lesser quality. 

If the prices here matched the subpar quality of food, then it would be ok. But the discrepancy between quality and price leaves me shaking my head. I honestly don't know how this place manages to be so packed on the weekends...it must be the State Street foot traffic. Don't be fooled through - there are much better Italian choices nearby.

It was packed so they must be doing something right but the food was not good and I felt it was over priced for what we got.  Their lasagna was packed with bland ground beef, not the 'homemade' lasagna I would expect for $17. Our pasta dishes were not good, and we got a side of salmon that had no flavor.  I agree with the comment that they try to mask the bad food with a good atmosphere.

There are a lot of positive reviews, so maybe we went on a bad night, but I'd think twice before going there.

Over the past year the quality of food seems to have deteriorated! The last few times I've ordered chicken picatta the chicken has been ridiculously rubbery. Not sure if they're using lower quality product to save cost or their kitchen staff turned over and they're over cooking the food. For the price, the foods just not worth it.

I am sad to see all the low starred reviews. Tutto pasta is my favorite Italian restaurant in town. The chicken Parmesan is the best in town. So cheesy and delicious. The bread that they bring you is also delicious and warm. The tables are indeed small but they make up for it with super service.

Stay away

I tried Tutto Pasta Trattoria based on Yelp Reviews of it one day for lunch and I cannot say anything good about it.

I cannot remember the exact name of the dish I ordered but it was lemon flavored chicken grilled on a bed of penne pasta and topped with goat cheese. 

Where do I start? For starters, my dish had way too much lemon juice. The citrus was bad and it did not go well with the goat cheese. The portion size wasn't worth that price I paid. I felt like they were really stingy with the portions.
